title: Good Omens - Episode 3 & 4 Recap - Spoilers
author: Dork Lords
comment: Best scene with Noah where Crowley says that you can't just drown all the children

Do you want the behind the scenes explanation for the way they did Hamlet? They talk about how expensive it would have been to bring in enough extras to fill up the Globe, plus they only had it for a limited time, so they decided to make it a really poorly performing play. (This was kind of funny because a David Tennant episode of Doctor Who was filmed in The Globe and there is a behind the scenes video explaining how they filled the theater using CGI. I guess Douglas Mackinnon and Neil Gaiman missed that episode, though the same company did the effects. I guess they didn't consult them in advance?)

Crowley didn't want the holy water to commit suicide. Aziraphale thought he did, which is why, initially, he refused to give it to him. Crowley said he just wanted it for insurance, and that is exactly how he used it.
